title: Probability and Sampling Distributions in Real-World Contexts
driving_question: How can we use probability and sampling distributions to predict outcomes in real-world scenarios?
short_background_context: In this mission, we will explore the concept of probability and sampling distributions through a real-world problem. We will focus on a scenario where employees have a chance to receive a gift card each week. The probability of an employee being selected to receive a gift card is independent each week. We will use the binomial distribution to model this scenario and calculate the probability of a particular outcome. This mission will help you understand how these mathematical concepts are used in real-world situations and will also enhance your problem-solving skills.

tasks.task1: Define the random variable in the given scenario and describe its distribution.

tasks.task2: Identify the event of interest and calculate its probability using the binomial distribution.

tasks.task3: Interpret the calculated probability in the context of the given scenario.

pre_thinking_prompts: What does the random variable represent in this scenario?
How would you describe the distribution of the random variable?
What is the event of interest and how can its probability be calculated?
reflection_prompt: What did you learn about using probability and sampling distributions in real-world scenarios? How can you apply this knowledge in other contexts?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain why the binomial distribution is appropriate for this scenario?
Why is it important to correctly identify the event of interest?
How does the calculated probability relate to the real-world scenario?
remix_zone: Try to remix this problem by changing the probability of an employee receiving a gift card each week or the number of weeks in a year. How do these changes affect the calculated probability?
